DOCNAME: CASE OF MANEVSKI v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Volodymyr Butkevych;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . Proceedings concerning an order of the Governor of ORG ( “ the first set of proceedings ” )
CARDINAL . The applicant worked as General Manager of a bank , “ GPE ” ( “ the bank ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Governor of ORG ( “ the Governor ” ) issued an order preventing the applicant from working as the bank ’s General Manager and from exercising other duties associated with special responsibilities for an indefinite period of time ( “ the order ” ) . The order was based on findings as to the applicant ’s unlawful business conduct and irregularities in the bank ’s operation under his management . On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal and confirmed the order .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law ( управен спор ) submitted on DATE and annulled the ORG ’s decision . It found that the position of general manager of a bank was not associated with special responsibilities and accordingly the order should not have been issued in respect of the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the applicant ’s actio popularis and declared section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW , under which the Governor had been entitled to take other measures ( apart from those explicitly mentioned ) if necessary , unconstitutional .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the provisions of LAW , in accordance with which the ORG decided upon appeals against the Governor ’s decisions , unconstitutional . It found that the Governor ’s participation in and chairing of the ORG when the latter decided against his decisions given at first instance had been contrary to the constitutional principle of CARDINAL - instance decision - making .

CARDINAL . On DATE the plenary session of ORG ( општа седница ) granted the public prosecutor ’s request for the protection of legality ( барање за заштита на законитоста ) and quashed ORG decision of DATE . The court referred in its decision to ORG authentic interpretation of section CARDINAL of ORG ( ORG за банки и штедилници ) , according to which the manager of a bank was to be considered “ a person with special responsibilities ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , relying on ORG decision of DATE , accepted the applicant ’s appeal and annulled the ORG ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . As the ORG allegedly remained inactive , the applicant requested ORG to decide his case on the merits instead of the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG , sitting without the Governor , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal and upheld the latter ’s decision . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request to decide his case on the merits instead of the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant ’s appeal and annulled the ORG ’s decision . It found that the ORG had established the facts incompletely and violated procedural rules .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal again .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a fresh appeal with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s appeal and annulled the ORG ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE and the order of DATE . It found that the Governor and the ORG had wrongly established that the applicant had abused the monetary system . On DATE the plenary session of ORG granted the public prosecutor ’s request for the protection of legality and quashed that decision . It found that the facts had been re - established without a hearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG finally dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . It based its decision , inter alia , on ORG of DATE , in accordance with which ORG supervised the lawfulness of a bank ’s operation and accordingly had been authorised to prevent , fully or partially , persons with special responsibilities from exercising their duties . It also referred to section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE and ruled that the latter had lawfully prevented the applicant from working as General Manager of the bank due to irregularities in the operation of the bank under his management .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant unsuccessfully requested the public prosecutor to lodge a request with ORG for the protection of legality .
CARDINAL . Civil proceedings concerning the applicant ’s forced retirement ( “ the second set of proceedings ” )
CARDINAL . On DATE the newly appointed General Manager of the bank dismissed the applicant as having fulfilled the conditions for his retirement .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bank ORG ( “ the Board ” ) dismissed the applicant ’s objection .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought a civil action challenging his forced retirement . He argued that he had not met the statutory conditions for entering retirement .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant ’s claim and annulled the bank ’s decisions . It gave the ruling after it had obtained an expert report concerning the applicant ’s period of employment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bank appealed . On DATE ORG quashed the lower court ’s decision and ordered a retrial .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant ’s claim again and annulled the bank ’s dismissal decisions . None of the scheduled hearings were adjourned upon the applicant ’s request .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the bank ’s appeal of DATE and quashed the lower court ’s decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Instance dismissed the applicant ’s claim . In the course of those proceedings , that court sought information from different institutions about the applicant ’s period of employment . On DATE it also appointed an expert to draw up a report in that connection and ordered those institutions to allow her access to the relevant documentation . The expert report was produced in DATE . On DATE ORG upheld the first - instance court ’s decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law ( ревизија ) with ORG . The proceedings are apparently still pending .
CARDINAL . Civil proceedings concerning the applicant ’s removal from the position of General Manager of the bank ( “ the third set of proceedings ” )
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG removed the applicant from the position of General Manager of the bank . On DATE the ORG dismissed the applicant ’s objection and terminated his contract with the bank .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE , the applicant instituted civil proceedings against the decisions of the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partially allowed the applicant ’s claim and annulled the ORG ’s decisions . The court dismissed the applicant ’s claim concerning the termination of the contract .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted both parties’ appeals and quashed the lower court ’s decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Instance dismissed the applicant ’s claim concerning his removal and rejected his claim related to the termination of his contract .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ruled partly in favour of the applicant , namely , it accepted his appeal concerning his removal and dismissed it in respect of his contract .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant ’s claim and annulled the ORG ’s decisions related to his removal ( “ the court order ” ) . That decision was upheld by ORG decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . After ORG had refused the applicant ’s request to “ reinstate his status prior to his removal ” ( воспоставување на правната состојба како пред разрешувањето ) , the applicant instituted enforcement proceedings claiming reinstatement and payment of salary arrears .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Instance dismissed the applicant ’s request as the court order had not provided for his reinstatement .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s appeal and remitted the case for re - examination , arguing that the court order had had a retrospective effect .
DATE . On DATE ORG Instance dismissed the applicant ’s claims for his reinstatement and for payment of salary arrears .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the lower court ’s decision and dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . By a letter of DATE , ORG stated that there was no evidence in the file attesting that a copy of that decision had been served on the applicant or his counsel .

CARDINAL . By an application of DATE , the applicant unsuccessfully requested the public prosecutor to lodge a request with ORG for the protection of legality ( барање за заштита на законитоста ) . His application was refused on DATE . On DATE that notification was allegedly served on the applicant .
